qudipy.qutils package

Submodules

qudipy.qutils.math module

qudipy.qutils.math.inner_prod(gparams, wf1, wf2)

Evaluates the inner product between two complex wavefunctions.

Parameters:

  • gparams (GridParameters class) – Contains grid and potential information.

  • wf1 (complex array) – ‘Bra’ wavefunction for the inner product. If grid is 2D, then the array should be in meshgrid format.

  • wf2 (complex array) – ‘Ket’ wavefunction for the inner product. If grid is 2D, then the array should be in meshgrid format.

  • Parameters (Optional) –

  • ---------------- –

  • None. –

Returns:

inn_prod – The inner product between the two inputted wavefunctions.

Return type:

complex float

qudipy.qutils.math.matrix_sqrt(A)

Calculates a square root of the specified matrix.

Parameters:

A (numpy array) – matrix to calculate the square root of

Returns:

sqrt_A – square root of the matrix

Return type:

complex 2D array

qudipy.qutils.math.partial_trace(rho, elem)

Finds partial trace with respect to the specified qubit(s)

Parameters:

  • rho (2D array) – matrix of the dimensions 2**N x 2**N (density matrix in our case)

  • elem (int / iterable of ints) – number(s) of the electron(s) whose state(s) is/are averaged out

Returns:

traced_rho – new density matrix of the dimensions 2**m x 2**m, m = N - dim(elem)

Return type:

complex 2D array

qudipy.qutils.math.partial_trace_general(rho, dim, traced_subsystem)

This code takes the partial trace of a density matrix. It is adapted from the open-source TrX file written by Toby Cubitt for MATLAB.

Parameters:

  • rho (complex 2D array) – A 2D array describing a density matrix.

  • dim (1D integer array) – An array of the dimensions of each subsystem for the whole system for psi. [2,4,2] corresponds to a system of size 2x4x2 with 3 subsystems.

  • traced_subsystem (1D array) – An array of the subsystems to trace out. For dim=[2,4,2], sys=[1,3] would trace out the first and third subsystems leaving only a subspace with size 4.

  • Parameters (Optional) –

  • ----------------- –

  • None. –

Returns:

traced_rho – The resulting rho after taking the partial trace.

Return type:

complex 2D array

qudipy.qutils.math.project_down(rho, elem)

Projects the system density matrix onto the spin-down state of the specified electron(s) (without renormalizing it).

Parameters:

  • rho (2D array) – Matrix of the dimensions 2**N x 2**N (density matrix in our case).

  • elem (int / iterable of ints) – Number(s) of the electron(s) whose state(s) is to project the system density matrix on.

  • Parameters (Optional) –

  • ---------------- –

  • None. –

Returns:

projected_rho – new density matrix (non-renormalized) of the dimensions 2**m x 2**m, where m = N - dim(elem)

Return type:

complex 2D array

qudipy.qutils.math.project_up(rho, elem)

Projects the system density matrix onto the spin-up state of the specified electron(s) (without renormalizing it)

Parameters:

  • rho (2D complex array) – Matrix of the dimensions 2**N x 2**N (density matrix in our case).

  • elem (int / iterable of ints) – Number(s) of the electron(s) whose state(s) is to project the system density matrix on.

  • Parameters (Optional) –

  • ---------------- –

  • None. –

Returns:

projected_rho – new density matrix (non-renormalized) of the dimensions 2**m x 2**m, where m = N - dim(elem)

Return type:

complex 2D array

qudipy.qutils.matrices module

Constant matrices used to define quantum gates @author: hromecB, zmerino

class qudipy.qutils.matrices.Operator(operators=None, filename=None, f_type=None)

Bases: object

Initialize Operator class. Handles all things realted to creating/loading/modifying operator object files which contain various operators in dictionary format. The Operator class also contains hard coded operators.

CNOT(N, ctrl, trgt, save=False)

Defines a matrix for CNOT gate.

Required Parameters

Nint

Number of 1-qubit degrees of freedom in the operators.

ctrl: int

Index of the control qubit.

trgt: int

Index of the target qubit.

savebool

boolean indicator from original function call to save the operator to the library if true.

Optional Parameters

None.. :returns: Matrix for CNOT gate :rtype: 2D complex array

E_DOWN(N, k, save=False)

Defines matrix that projects k-th qubit on the state |↓〉≡ |1〉

Required Parameters

Nint

Number of 1-qubit degrees of freedom in the operators.

kint

Position of the projection matrix in the tensor product.

savebool

boolean indicator from original function call to save the operator to the library if true.

Optional Parameters

None..

returns:

Matrix |1〉〈1|_k of dimensions 2**N x 2**N

rtype:

2D complex array

check_name(filename=None)

Check that a file name for an object file has the correct extension, and if not, try to correct it or raise an error.

Optional Parameters

filename: string

String that indicates the name of the existing object file which contains a library of operators.

rtype:

String with ‘.npz’ appended if no other file extension existed

Required Parameters

Operator dictionary

rtype:

None..

check_unitary(dict)

Checks if a dictionary’s operator items are all unitary.

Required Parameters

dictDictionary

Operator dictionary

rtype:

None..

coded_op(save, **kwargs)

Manages arbitrarily defined operators that were hard coded i.e. saves the operator to the operator library if specified in the operator function call and only computes the operator if it does not exist in the operator library. ———- func : function

An arbitrary function is sent.

op_keystr

Operator key name.

savebool

boolean indicator from original function call to save the operator to the library if true.

**kwargsdictionary
General structure: {‘var1’: val1, …, ‘varN’: valN,

‘struct’: stuct, ‘func’, func}

Contains variable names and values used to construct the operator, as well as, functions to help constuct the operator and operator library name.

Returns:

The computed or loaded operator

Return type:

complex 2D array

construct(N, k, O, key_prefix=None)

Creates matrix U_k of dimensions 2**N x 2**N for specified operator O

Required Parameters

N: int

Number of 1-qubit degrees of freedom in the operator.

k: int

Position of the Pauli matrix in the tensor product.

O: 2D complex array key_prefix: string

optional key prefix name argument. Key structure is key_prefix_N#K#.

returns:

u_k – Matrix U_k of dimensions 2**N x 2**N

rtype:

2D complex array

keys()

Load the operator object file for later use.

Required Parameters

Name of the file with extension .npz for the operator object.

returns:

lib – Dictionary containing operators.

rtype:

Dictionary

Required Parameters

List of dictionary key strings that are to be removed from the existing dictionary.

rtype:

None..

save_ops(filename=None)

Save the operator dictionary in the current working directory as an object file for later use.

Required Parameters

filenameString

Name of operator dictionary file. If the file type suffix is not included in the filename, it will be appended on to the filename string.

rtype:

None..

qudipy.qutils.solvers module

Quantum utility solver functions

@author: simba

qudipy.qutils.solvers.build_1DSE_hamiltonian(material_system, gparams)

Build a single electron Hamilonian for the 1-dimensional potential specified in the gparams class. The laplacian operator is approximated by using a 1D 3-point stencil. The Hamilonian assumes a natural ordering format along the main diagonal.

Parameters:

  • material_system (Material class) – Object that contains material parameters and dependencies.

  • gparams (GridParameters class) – Contains grid and potential information

Returns:

ham_1D – 1-dimensional Hamtilonian. The diagonal elements are in natural ordering format

Return type:

sparse 2D array

qudipy.qutils.solvers.build_2DSE_hamiltonian(material_system, gparams)

Build a single electron Hamilonian for the 2-dimensional potential specified in the gparams class. The laplacian operator is approximated by using a 2D 5-point stencil. The Hamiltonian assumes a natural ordering format along the main diagonal.

Parameters:

  • material_system (Material class) – Object that contains material parameters and dependencies.

  • gparams (GridParameters class) – Contains grid and potential information

Returns:

ham_2D – 2-dimensional Hamtilonian. The diagonal elements are in natural ordering format.

Return type:

sparse 2D array

qudipy.qutils.solvers.solve_schrodinger_eq(material_system, gparams, n_sols=1)

Solve the time-independent Schrodinger-Equation H|Y> = E|Y> where H is the single-electron 1 (or 2)-dimensional Hamiltonian.

Parameters:

  • material_system (Material class) – Object that contains material parameters and dependencies.

  • gparams (GridParameters class) – Contains grid and potential information.

  • Parameters (Optional) –

  • ----------------- –

  • n_sols (int, optional) – Number of eigenvectors and eigenenergies to return. The default is 1.

Returns:

  • eig_ens (complex 1D array) – Lowest eigenenergies sorted in ascending order.

  • eig_vecs (complex 2D array) – Corresponding eigenvectors in natural order format. eig_vecs[:,i] is the eigenvector for eigenvalue eig_ens[i].
